summary: This document is an email chain from November 2021 regarding the review of juror questionnaires in the US v. Maxwell case. It involves coordination between prosecution team members and a contractor to distribute, review, and share juror questionnaires with the defense counsel.

events.title: Juror Questionnaires Distributed for Review
events.description: Juror questionnaires are scanned, uploaded, and distributed to the prosecution team for review. Hard copies are delivered to chambers and made available for defense counsel.

events.title: Prosecution Team Review Deadline
events.description: Prosecution team members are required to submit their comments and objections on assigned juror questionnaires by 11 a.m.

keyFacts: The email chain pertains to the jury selection process for the US v. Maxwell trial in November 2021.
Prosecution team members and a contractor are coordinating the review of juror questionnaires and sharing them with defense counsel.
A specific deadline of 11 a.m. on November 13, 2021, is set for the prosecution team to submit juror comments and objections.
Juror questionnaires are uploaded to a system called 'USAfx' and hard copies are delivered to chambers and the defense.
The document references an 'updated 3500+GX' that was produced to the defense, likely referring to discovery materials.
